JSRDotNETSDK Reference

IPulserReceiver Members

IPulserReceiver Interface  Events  Methods  Properties  See Also

Interface for pulser receiver. An instrument can have multiple pulser receivers.

The following tables list the members exposed by the IPulserReceiver type.

Properties
Name Description
DampingIndex Gets or sets the zero-based index of the pulser damping. The actual damping value corresponding to the available indices can be read from the DampingValues array.
DampingIndexMax Gets the damping index maximum.
DampingIndexSupported Gets a value indicating whether the damping index property is supported.
DampingValues Gets the damping values in Ohms.
EnergyPerPulse Gets the energy per pulse in Joules. This property is simply the amount of energy stored in the pulser's capacitor which is used to create the outgoing pulse. Not all of these energy is necessarily delivered to the pulser, since there may be some losses.
Gain Gets or sets the gain in dB. Chooses the closest legal gain value.
GainIndex Gets or sets the zero-based gain index. To find the value, see GainValues property. This property will only have an effect if GainIndexPropertySupported is true for this particular model of instrument. Otherwise, use the Gain property to get or set the gain.
GainIndexMax Gets the gain index maximum.
GainIndexSupported Gets a value indicating whether the gain index property is enabled. For receivers which have only a few possible values of gain, this alternative method for setting gain can be used to select the gain from the GainValues array. Some instruments do not allow this method because they support a range of closely spaced gain values which makes the list of allowed gains less useful.
GainMax Gets the gain maximum in dB.
GainMin Gets the gain minimum in dB.
GainStepSize Gets the size of the gain step. For example if the gain step size is 0.5, and the GainMin is -22.0 dB, then the next valid gain value is -21.5 dB. This property only has a meaningful value if GainStepSizeSupported is true.
GainStepSizeSupported Gets a value indicating whether the gain step size is supported by a receiver. If an instrument does not have regular increments between min and max gain, then this property indicates that the GainStepSize property should be ignored.
GainSupported Gets a value indicating whether the gain supported.
GainValues Gets an array of gain values in dB corresponding to the GainIndex property. This property will only have values if the GainIndexSupported property is true.
HVMeasurement Returns current floating point voltages of HV Supply in Volts. Only accurate to nearest 1/10th of a volt. Not all instruments support this property.
HVMeasurementSupported Returns True if HVMeasurement property is supported.
HVSupply Gets or sets the voltage of the pulser high voltage supply.
HVSupplyEnable Gets or sets a value indicating whether this Pulser's High Voltage power supply is enabled. Only some instruments have this capability.
HVSupplyEnableSupported Gets a value indicating whether the hv supply enable supported.
HVSupplyIndex Gets or sets the zero-based index of the pulser volts, if this property is available for this pulser receiver.
HVSupplyIndexMax Gets the pulser volts index maximum value. If the HVSupplyIndex property is not available in this pulser receiver, zero will be returned. The number of available pulser voltages is this value minus one.
HVSupplyIndexSupported Gets a value indicating whether the high voltage value can be selected by index;
HVSupplyMax Gets the pulser high voltage supply maximum voltage.
HVSupplyMin Gets the pulser high voltage supply minimum voltage.
HVSupplySupported Gets a value indicating whether the pulser HVSupply property is supported.
HVSupplyValues Gets the voltages which can be selected by HVSupplyIndex property. If this property is not supported for this pulser receiver, this is an array of zero elements.
HasManualControls Gets a value indicating whether this object has physical controls.
HighPassFilterIndex Gets or sets the zero-based index of the high pass filter.
HighPassFilterIndexMax The maximum allowed index for the low pass filter selection. The number of low pass filter selections is equal to this plus one.
HighPassFilterIndexSupported Gets a value indicating whether the high pass filter index supported.
HighPassFilterValues Gets the high pass cutoff frequencies in MHz for each possible index.
Id Gets the identification object of the pulser receiver.
Info Gets the hardware and or connection information for this pulser receiver and the instrument. Note not all pulser receivers have the same information available. Possible element names are InstrumentModel, InstrumentSerialNum, InstrumentAddress, InstrumentFWRevision, InstrumentHWRevision, PulserModel, ReceiverModel, PulserSerialNum, ReceiverSerialNum, PulserHWRevision, ReceiverHWRevision, SerialPortName, InstrumentAddress,.
IsPulserPresent Returns true if a pulser is attached to this PulserReceiver.
IsPulserPresentSupported Returns true if IsPulserPresent property is supported
LEDBlinkModeIndex Gets or sets the zero-based index of the LED blink mode.
LEDBlinkModeIndexMax Gets the LED blink mode index maximum. The number of possible LED blink modes is this minus one.
LEDBlinkModeIndexSupported Gets a value indicating whether the LED blink mode index property is enabled.
LEDBlinkModeValues Gets the names of all the possible LED blink modes available by setting the LEDBlinkModeIndex property.
LowPassFilterIndex Gets or sets the zero-based index of the current selected low pass filter selection.
LowPassFilterIndexMax The maximum allowed index for the low pass filter selection. The number of low pass filter selections is equal to this plus one.
LowPassFilterIndexSupported Gets a value indicating whether the low pass filter index supported.
LowPassFilterValues Gets the low pass cutoff frequencies in MHz for each possible index.
MaxFrequency Gets the the base receiver max frequency in Mhz. This a fixed characteristic of the receiver hardware and does not change when the low pass or high pass filter settings are changed.
PulseEnergyIndex Gets or sets the zero-based index of the pulse energy selection.
PulseEnergyIndexMax Gets the pulse energy index maximum.
PulseEnergyIndexSupported Gets a value indicating whether the pulser energy index property is enabled.
PulseEnergyValueNames Gets a list of names of the available pulse energy values.
PulseRepetitionFrequency Gets or sets the pulse repetition frequency if an internal trigger is available in this pulser receiver. If the specified frequency is not attainable, the closest attainable frequency will be chosen. On some instruments, the frequencies available are not equally spaced because the PRF is generated by dividing a clock. So the resulting PRF is changed by adjusting the denominator of a fraction. Such as 24,000,000/24,000 = PRF of 1000 Hz. The Numerator is fixed, and when you set a PRF, the instrument looks for the best denominator to attain the desired frequency. The fixed Numerator is another property that is available as PulseRepetitionFrequencyNumerator. This only applies to the internal PRF. When using external trigger, none of this is relevant. After setting this property, the property can be read to determine the frequency actually attained.
PulseRepetitionFrequencyIndex Gets or sets the zero-based index of the internally generated pulse repetition frequency if the TriggerSource property is set to Internal. See the PulserRepetitionFreqValues property for the list of actually attainable frequencies.
PulseRepetitionFrequencyIndexMax The maximum number allowed for the PulseRepetitionFrequencyIndex property, or zero if this property cannot be used with this pulser receiver.
PulseRepetitionFrequencyIndexSupported Gets a value indicating whether the pulser repetition frequency index property can be used on this pulser receiver.
PulseRepetitionFrequencyMax Gets the maximum possible pulse repetition frequency maximum in Hz.
PulseRepetitionFrequencyMin Gets the minimum possible pulse repetition frequency maximum in Hz.
PulseRepetitionFrequencyNumerator Gets the pulse repetition frequency numerator. On some instruments, the Pulse Repetition Frequency is determined by calculating PRF_Numerator/PRF_Denominator, where the Numerator is fixed and the Denominator varies. If the instrument does not adjust the internal PRF by dividing a clock, then this value will be zero. See the PulserRepetitionFrequency property for more information.
PulseRepetitionFrequencySupported Gets a value indicating whether the pulse repetition frequency supported.
PulseRepetitionFrequencyValues Gets an array of attainable PRF values if this pulser receiver supports the PulseRepetionFrequencyIndex property.
PulserEnergyCapacitorValues Returns a list of pulser energy capacitor values in micro-farads.
PulserEnergyCapacitorValuesSupported Returns true if the PulserEnergyCapacitorValues property is supported.
PulserFirmwareVer Gets the Pulser Firmware Version string
PulserFirmwareVerSupported Gets a value which indicates if the PulserFirmwareVer property is supported
PulserHWRev Gets the Pulser Hardware Revision String
PulserHWRevSupported Gets a value which indicates if the PulserHWRev property is supported
PulserImpedance Gets or sets the pulser output impedance. Currently only implemented in the DPR300, the LOW_Z option provides a higher pulse energy but with a side effect of lessening the effect of the damping resistor, resulting in less damping. (See the DampingIndex property)
PulserImpedanceSupported Gets a value indicating whether the PulserImpedance property is supported.
PulserIsPulsing Gets a value indicating whether the pulser is currently being triggered. Some instruments do not have the ability to detect this when using an external trigger. When such instruments are set to external trigger, a value of UNKNOWN will be returned.
PulserMaxPRFs Returns an array of max PRF frequencies in Hz, one for each energy setting of the pulser.
PulserMaxPRFsSupported Returns true if the PulserMaxPRFs property is supported.
PulserModelName Gets the Pulser Model name string
PulserModelNameSupported Gets a value which indicates if the PulserModelName property is supported
PulserOEMData Gets or sets the OEM Data for a remote pulser. OEM data is a byte array of exactly 8 bytes. It is stored in EEPROM and will be preserved if unit is powered down. It will remain set until overwritten with something else. This data is not used by the product's firmware, it is meant as a convenience for developers who may wish to authenticate the identity of this particular unit.
PulserOEMDataSupported Gets a bool value which indicates if the remote pulser OEM Data property is supported
PulserPowerLimitStatus Gets the current pulser power limit status. Some pulsers can be damaged or suffer a reduction in performance when the combination pulser voltage and pulse repetition frequency is too high. This property returns an integer based on the current settings of the instrument. Some instruments cannot detect the pulse repetition frequency when an external trigger source is used. In this case, this property will return UNKNOWN.
PulserSerialNum Gets the Pulser serial num if supported
PulserSerialNumSupported Returns true if PulserSerialNum property is supported.
PulserSettings Returns a collection of PulserSettingInfo structures. Each PulserSettingInfo object in the collection corresponds to a setting such as Gain, TriggerEnable, or LowPassFilter, etc. Note that a PulserSettingInfo object describes a setting, which in turn is usually implemented as a number of properties. For example, the setting 'LowPassFilter' is implemented in pulser objects as LowPassFilterIndex, LowPassFilterIndexMax, and LowPassFilterValues. The PulserSettingInfo object returns information about the LowPassFilter setting in general, and information about the three actual properties can be discovered from that PulserSettingInfo object. Note that in addition to the standard properties always implemented in the IPulserReceiver interface, there may be additional settings such as custom features. For example, the PulserReceiver_DPR object implements IPulserReceiver. But in addition, there is an additional read-only setting called IsPulserPresent, because the DPR500 is unique in that the instrument can still be connected while one of its remote pulsers is disconnected. Thus, even though the property IsPulserPresent is not in the IPulserReceiver interface, application software can still read the value of this by calling the GetPropertyValue() method on the PulserSettingInfo object, or by using the GetPulserPropertyValue() method of the IPulserReceiver while using the appropriate setting name and role.
PulserTriggerCount Gets the accumulated trigger count since the device was power cycled.
PulserTriggerCountSupported Gets a value indicating whether the PulserTriggerCount property is supported.
PulserTriggerSourceIndex Gets or sets the zero-based index of the trigger source selection.
PulserTriggerSourceIndexMax Gets the pulser trigger source index maximum.
PulserTriggerSourceValueNames Gets a list of names of the available pulse energy values.
ReceiverFirmwareVer Gets the Receiver Firmware Version string
ReceiverFirmwareVerSupported Gets a value which indicates if the ReceiverFirmwareVer property is supported
ReceiverHWRev Gets the Receiver Hardware Revision string
ReceiverHWRevSupported Gets a value which indicates if the ReceiverHWRev property is supported
ReceiverMode Gets or sets or the receiver signal input mode.
ReceiverModeBothSupported Gets a value indicating whether the signal select both mode supported.
ReceiverModeEchoSupported Gets a value indicating whether the signal select echo mode supported.
ReceiverModeThruSupported Gets a value indicating whether the signal select thru mode supported.
ReceiverModelName Receiver Model name string
ReceiverModelNameSupported Gets a value which indicates if the ReceiverModelName property is supported.
ReceiverOEMData Gets or sets the OEM Data for a unit. OEM data is a byte array of exactly 8 bytes. It is stored in EEPROM and will be preserved if unit is powered down. It will remain set until overwritten with something else. This data is not used by the product's firmware, it is meant as a convenience for developers who may wish to authenticate the identity of this particular unit.
ReceiverOEMDataSupported Gets a bool value which indicates if the OEM Data property is supported
ReceiverSerialNum Gets the Receiver serial num if supported
ReceiverSerialNumSupported Returns true if ReceiverSerialNum property is supported.
ReceiverSupplyVoltages Gets the supply voltages.
ReceiverSupplyVoltagesSupported Gets if the supply voltage property is supported.
State Gets the present state of this pulser/receiver instance.
StatusChangePropertyCriteria Gets or sets the status change property filter. If this property is never set, it remains its default value, null. If the filter is null, then all property changes will generate change events. If not null, then only properties which are included in the filter will generate property change events.
TriggerEdgePolarity The trigger fires on rising or falling edge.
TriggerEdgePolaritySupported Gets a value indicating whether the trigger edge polarity property is enabled.
TriggerEnable Gets or sets the trigger enable. Note: The DPR300 may report this property incorrectly if this property has not been written to since the last time the instrument was power cycled.
TriggerImpedance Gets or sets the trigger impedance.
TriggerImpedanceSupported Gets a value indicating whether the TriggerImpedance property is supported.
TriggerSource Gets or sets the trigger source.
TriggerSourceExternalSupported Gets a value indicating whether the external trigger is supported on this instrument.
TriggerSourceInternalSupported Gets a value indicating whether the internal triggers are supported on this instrument.
TriggerSourceSlaveSupported Gets a value indicating whether the trigger source slave mode is supported.
UnitModelName Gets or sets the model name for a unit. Setting this property will fail unless unit is in factory mode.
UnitModelNameSupported Gets a bool value which indicates if the UnitModelName propery is supported
UnitSerialNum Gets or sets the serial number for a unit. Setting the serial number will fail unless unit is in factory mode.
UnitSerialNumSupported Gets a bool value which indicates if the UnitSerialNum propery is supported
Top
Methods
Name Description
ForceDetach Causes this pulser receiver object to fire a Status Change event indicating the pulser receiver has been detached. The pulser receiver object will be removed from the library's lists. If the library's InstrumentDiscoveryEnable property is true, a new Pulser Receiver object will be created, and a InstrumentDiscoveredEvent will be fired and the pulser receiver object will be available for use.
GetCustomSettings Gets a list of the custom settings supported by this pulser/receiver.
GetPulserPropertyAttributes Returns an integer of logical or'd bitflags indicating various properties of a setting such as whether it is indexed or readonly etc.
GetPulserPropertyUnits Returns the unit of measure for the setting. The setting name is the base prefix for the property using the values from the SettingNames class.
GetPulserPropertyUnitsAsString Returns the unit of measure for the setting. The setting name is the base prefix for the property using the values from the SettingNames class.
GetPulserPropertyValue (Overloaded) An alternative method for reading the value of a property is to provide a string prefix name. The result will be an integer, double, string or array boxed into an object. The prefix name consists of begining characters of the specific properties. For example, there are many .NET properties associated with gain, such as GainIndex, GainMax, etc. The prefix name for all these properties is SettingNames.Gain. In this case, to get the gain using this method: double gain = (double) GetPulserPropertyValue(SettingNames.Gain, JSRDotNETPropRole.DIRECT); If there is no .NET property with this role, a null will be returned.
GetPulserSettingInfo Given the pulser setting name (such as 'Gain' or 'HVSupply'), this method returns an object with info about which .NET properties exist which are associated with this pulser property. This method will return the standard properties guaranteed by the interface but also can return new properties which are not in the interface, but might be only present for a specific model. To get a list of prefix names, see the static function PulserPropertyInfo.CreateListOfPulserProperties() method. Note that if a setting by this name cannot be found, a null will be returned, so that should be tested for.
IsPulserSettingSupported A quick way to see if the pulser receiver supports this pulser setting.
Refresh Refreshes this pulser/receiver instance. If the pulser/receiver is in the error state, it will attempt to re-initialize the connection.
SetPulserPropertyValue (Overloaded) As an alternative to directly setting a pulser property (as in pulser.Gain = 10.0), a setting can be set with the following method where the property is selected by name. For example: SetPulserPropertyValue(PRPropertyNames.Gain, (object) 10.0);
Top
Events
Name Description
StatusChangeEventHandler Event queue for all listeners interested in StatusChangeEventHandler events.
